SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT508
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message is sent by an account servicer (account servicing institution) to an account owner or its designated agent. The account servicer may be a local agent (sub-custodian) acting on behalf of their global custodian customer, or a custodian acting on behalf of an investment management institution or a broker/dealer.
This message is used to confirm the increase or decrease in securities with a given status within a holding, ie, intra-position transfer.

Validation.Comment: Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Function must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T86) :

Code.Name: CANC
Code.Description: Message requesting the cancellation of a previously sent message.

Code.Name: NEWM
Code.Description: New message.

Validation.Comment: Subfunction, when present, must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T85) :

Code.Name: CODU
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes and the message is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Code.Name: COPY
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes.

Code.Name: DUPL
Code.Description: Message is for information/confirmation purposes. It is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38) .
UTC Indicator must be a valid time expressed as HH[MM] (Error code(s): T39) .
Sign must not be used when UTC Indicator is equal to all zeroes (Error code(s): T14) .
Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)
Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. (Error code(s): T26) .
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)
Country must be a valid ISO country code (Error code(s): T73) .
Narrative (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
In option B, if Data Source Scheme is not present, Place Code must contain the following code (Error code(s): K94):

Code.Name: SHHE
Code.Description: Used for certain financial instruments, eg, US mutual funds, where settlement is internal only, ie, there is no external movement of securities.

Validation.Comment: In option F, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K94):

Code.Name: CUST
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at a local custodian.

Code.Name: ICSD
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at an International Central Securities Depository.

Code.Name: NCSD
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at a National Central Securities Depository.

Code.Name: SHHE
Code.Description: Used for certain financial instruments, eg, US mutual funds, where settlement is internal only, ie, there is no external movement of securities.

Qualifier.Name: PSTT
Qualifier.Description: Quantity of Financial Instrument Previously Settled

Qualifier.Name: RSTT
Qualifier.Description: Quantity of Financial Instrument Remaining to be Settled

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36) :

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03)
When Sign is present, Amount must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Narrative must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
In option B, if Data Source Scheme is not present, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K94) :

Code.Name: EXCH
Code.Description: Place of listing is a stock exchange.

Code.Name: OTCO
Code.Description: Place of listing is over the counter.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is CFRE, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: ANNU
Code.Description: Frequency is annual.

Code.Name: MNTH
Code.Description: Frequency is monthly.

Code.Name: QUTR
Code.Description: Frequency is quarterly.

Code.Name: SEMI
Code.Description: Frequency is semi-annual.

Code.Name: WEEK
Code.Description: Frequency is weekly.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is FORM and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: BEAR
Code.Description: Financial instruments are in bearer form.

Code.Name: REGD
Code.Description: Financial instruments are in registered form.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is MICO , Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year, divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year, divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014 . See Narrative.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is PAYS and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: FULL
Code.Description: Financial instrument is fully paid.

Code.Name: NILL
Code.Description: Financial instrument is nil paid.

Code.Name: PART
Code.Description: Financial instrument is partially paid.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is PFRE and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: ANNU
Code.Description: Payment frequency is annual.

Code.Name: MNTH
Code.Description: Payment frequency is monthly.

Code.Name: QUTR
Code.Description: Payment frequency is quarterly.

Code.Name: SEMI
Code.Description: Payment frequency is semi-annual.

Code.Name: WEEK
Code.Description: Payment frequency is weekly.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is OPST and Data Source Scheme is not present, Instrument Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K12) :

Code.Name: AMER
Code.Description: Option can be exercised before or on expiry date.

Code.Name: EURO
Code.Description: Option can be exercised on expiry date only.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is OPTI and Data Source Scheme is not present, Instrument Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K12) :

Code.Name: CALL
Code.Description: A right to buy a defined quantity of an asset by a certain date at an agreed price.

Code.Name: PUTO
Code.Description: A right to sell a defined quantity of an asset by a certain date at an agreed price.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .

Validation.Qualifiers: CALD, COUP, DDTE, EXPI, FCOU, FRNR, ISSU, MATU, PUTT
Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .

Validation.Qualifiers: CUFC, INDX, INTR, NWFC, NXRT, PRFC, YTMR
Validation.Comment: When Sign is present, Rate must not be zero (Error code(s): T14) .
Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Flag must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K17) :

Code.Name: N
Code.Description: No.

Code.Name: Y
Code.Description: Yes.

Validation.Comment: Amount Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90) :

Code.Name: ACTU
Code.Description: Price expressed as an amount of currency per unit or per share.

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as a discount amount.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as a premium.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Percentage Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90) :

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points below par, eg, a discount price of 2.0% equals a price of 98 when par is 100.

Code.Name: PRCT
Code.Description: Price expressed as a percentage of par.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points above par, eg, a premium price of 2.0% equals a price of 102 when par is 100.

Code.Name: YIEL
Code.Description: Price expressed as a yield.

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36) :

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38) .
If Qualifier is CAEV and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: ACCU
Code.Description: Funds related event in which the income (for example accumulation units) that accrues during an accounting period is retained within the fund instead of being paid away to investors. The retained income is nonetheless deemed to have been distributed to investors for tax purposes.

Code.Name: ACTV
Code.Description: Trading in the security has commenced or security has been re-activated after a suspension in trading.

Code.Name: ATTI
Code.Description: Combination of different security types to create a unit. Units are usually comprised of warrants and bonds or warrants and equities. Securities may be combined at the request of the security holder or based on market convention.

Code.Name: BIDS
Code.Description: Offer to existing holders by the issuing company to repurchase its own securities. The objective of the offer is to reduce the number of outstanding securities.

Code.Name: BMET
Code.Description: Physical meeting of bond holders.

Code.Name: BONU
Code.Description: Bonus, scrip or capitalisation issue. Security holders receive additional assets free of payment from the issuer, in proportion to their holding.

Code.Name: BPUT
Code.Description: Early redemption of a bond at the election of the bondholder subject to the terms and condition of the issue with no reduction in nominal value .

Code.Name: BRUP
Code.Description: Legal status of a company unable to pay creditors. Bankruptcy usually involves a formal court ruling. Securities may become valueless.

Code.Name: CAPD
Code.Description: The Corporate event pays shareholders an amount in cash issued from the Capital account. There is no reduction to the face value of a single share(or the share has no par value). The number of circulating shares remains unchanged.

Code.Name: CAPG
Code.Description: Distribution of profits resulting from the sale of securities. Shareholders of mutual funds, unit trusts, or sicavs may be recipients of capital gains distributions which are often reinvested in additional equity of the fund.

Code.Name: CAPI
Code.Description: Increase of the current principal of a debt instrument without increasing the nominal value. It normally arises from the incorporation of due but unpaid interest into the principal. This is commonly done by increasing the pool factor value, for example, capitalisation, and negative amortisation.

Code.Name: CERT
Code.Description: Non-US beneficial owner certification requirement for exchange of temporary to permanent notes.

Code.Name: CHAN
Code.Description: Information regarding a change further described in the corporate action details.

Code.Name: CLSA
Code.Description: Situation where interested parties seek restitution for financial loss. The security holder may be offered the opportunity to join a class action proceeding and would need to respond with an instruction.

Code.Name: CMET
Code.Description: Announcement of a meeting at a Court.

Code.Name: CONS
Code.Description: Procedure that aims to obtain consent of holder to a proposal by the issuer or a third party without convening a meeting . For example, consent to change the terms of a bond.

Code.Name: CONV
Code.Description: Conversion of securities, generally convertible bonds or preferred equity, into another form of securities, usually common equity.

Code.Name: COOP
Code.Description: A Company Option may be granted by the company, allowing the holder to take up shares at some future date(s) at a pre arranged price in the company. A company may not grant options which enable the holder to take up unissued shares at a time which is five or more years from the date of the grant. Option holders are not members of a company. They are contingent creditors of a company and hence may, in some instances, be entitled to vote on and be bound by a scheme of arrangement between the creditors and the company. As many options have multiple exercise periods a company option will either lapse or carry on to the next expiry date.

Code.Name: CREV
Code.Description: An occurrence of credit derivative for which the issuer of one or several underlying securities is unable to fulfill his financial obligations (as defined in terms and conditions).

Code.Name: DECR
Code.Description: Reduction of face value of a single share or the value of fund assets. The number of circulating shares/units remains unchanged. This event may include a cash payout to holders.

Code.Name: DETI
Code.Description: Separation of components that comprise a security, usually units comprised of warrants and bonds or warrants and equities. The units may be broken up at the request of the security holder or based on market convention.

Code.Name: DFLT
Code.Description: Failure by the company to perform obligations defined as default events under the bond agreement and that have not been remedied.

Code.Name: DLST
Code.Description: Security is no longer able to comply with the listing requirements of a stock exchange and is removed from official board quotation.

Code.Name: DRAW
Code.Description: Redemption in part before the scheduled final maturity date of a security. Drawing is distinct from partial call since drawn bonds are chosen by lottery and with no reduction in nominal value.

Code.Name: DRCA
Code.DetailedName: Cash Distribution From Non-Eligible Securities Sales
Code.Description: Distribution to shareholders of cash resulting from the selling of non-eligible securities, for example, in the frame of a depositary receipt program.

Code.Name: DRIP
Code.Description: Dividend payment where cash dividend is rolled over into additional shares in the issuing company.

Code.Name: DSCL
Code.Description: Requirement for holders or beneficial owners to disclose their name, location and holdings of any issue to the issuer.

Code.Name: DTCH
Code.Description: An action by a party wishing to acquire a security. Holders of the security are invited to make an offer to sell, within a specific price range. The acquiring party will buy from the holder with lowest offer.

Code.Name: DVCA
Code.Description: Distribution of cash to shareholders, in proportion to their equity holding. Ordinary dividends are recurring and regular.

Code.Name: DVOP
Code.Description: Distribution of a dividend to shareholders with a choice of benefit to receive. Shareholders may choose to receive shares, cash or both.

Code.Name: DVSC
Code.Description: Dividend or interest paid in the form of scrip.

Code.Name: DVSE
Code.Description: Dividend paid to shareholders in the form of equities of the issuing corporation.

Code.Name: EXOF
Code.Description: Exchange of holdings for other securities and/or cash. The exchange can be either mandatory or voluntary involving the exchange of outstanding securities for different securities and/or cash. For example "exchange offer", "capital reorganisation" or "funds separation" .

Code.Name: EXRI
Code.Description: Call or exercise on nil paid securities or intermediate securities resulting from an intermediate securities distribution (RHDI). This code is used for the second event, when an intermediate securities' issue (rights/coupons) is composed of two events, the first event being the distribution of intermediate securities.

Code.Name: EXTM
Code.Description: As stipulated in a bond's Terms and Conditions, the issuer or the bond-holder may prolong the maturity date of a bond. After extension, the security may differ from original issue (new rate or maturity date). May be subject to bondholder's approval.

Code.Name: EXWA
Code.Description: Warrant conversion. Option offered to holders to buy (call warrant) or to sell (put warrant) a specific amount of stock, cash, or commodity, at a predetermined price, during a predetermined period of time (which usually corresponds to the life of the issue).

Code.Name: INCR
Code.Description: Increase in the face value of a single security. The number of circulating securities remains unchanged. This event may include a cash payout to holders.

Code.Name: INFO
Code.Description: Information provided by the issuer having no accounting/financial impact on the holder.

Code.Name: INTR
Code.Description: Interest payment distributed to holders of an interest bearing asset.

Code.Name: LIQU
Code.Description: A distribution of cash, assets or both. Debt may be paid in order of priority based on preferred claims to assets specified by the security.

Code.Name: MCAL
Code.Description: The redemption of an entire issue outstanding of securities, eg, bonds, preferred equity, funds, by the issuer or its agent, eg, asset manager, before final maturity.

Code.Name: MEET
Code.Description: Annual general meeting.

Code.Name: MRGR
Code.Description: Exchange of outstanding securities, initiated by the issuer which may include options, as the result of two or more companies combining assets, that is, an external, third party company. Cash payments may accompany share exchange.

Code.Name: NOOF
Code.Description: Offers that are not supervised or regulated by an official entity and being offered by a party, for example a broker, usually at a discount price, for example broker offer, mini-tender, mini odd lot offer or third party offer.

Code.Name: ODLT
Code.Description: Sale or purchase of odd-lots to/from the issuing company, initiated either by the holder of the security or through an offer made by the issuer.

Code.Name: OMET
Code.Description: Ordinary general meeting.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other event.

Code.Name: PARI
Code.Description: Assimilation. Occurs when securities with different characteristics, eg, shares with different entitlements to dividend or voting rights, become identical in all respects, ie, pari-passu. May be scheduled in advance, eg, shares resulting from a bonus may become fungible after a pre-set period of time, or result from outside events, eg, merger, reorganisation, issue of supplementary tranches, etc.

Code.Name: PCAL
Code.DetailedName: Partial Redemption With Reduction of Nominal Value
Code.Description: Securities are redeemed in part before their scheduled final maturity date with reduction of the nominal value of the securities. The outstanding amount of securities will be reduced proportionally.

Code.Name: PDEF
Code.Description: Issuer has money set aside to redeem a portion of an issue and the indenture states that the securities could be called earlier than the stated maturity.

Code.Name: PINK
Code.Description: Interest payment, in any kind except cash, distributed to holders of an interest bearing asset.

Code.Name: PLAC
Code.Description: Changes in the state of incorporation for US companies and changes in the place of incorporation for foreign companies. Where shares need to be registered following the incorporation change, the holder(s) may have to elect the registrar.

Code.Name: PPMT
Code.Description: An instalment towards the purchase of equity capital, subject to an agreement between an issuer and a purchaser.

Code.Name: PRED
Code.DetailedName: Partial Redemption Without Reduction of Nominal Value
Code.Description: Securities are redeemed in part before their scheduled final maturity date without reduction of the nominal value of the securities. This is commonly done by pool factor reduction.

Code.Name: PRII
Code.Description: An event which consists of two components, the decrease of the amortized value of a pool factor security and an interest payment.

Code.Name: PRIO
Code.Description: Form of open or public offer where, due to a limited amount of securities available, priority is given to existing shareholders.

Code.Name: REDM
Code.Description: The redemption of an entire issue outstanding of securities, eg, bonds, preferred equity, funds, by the issuer or its agent, eg, asset manager, at final maturity.

Code.Name: REDO
Code.Description: Event by which the unit (currency and/or nominal) of a security is restated, eg, nominal/par value of security in a national currency is restated in another currency.

Code.Name: REMK
Code.Description: Purchase and sale of remarketed preferred equities/bonds through the negotiation of interest rate between the issuers and the holders.

Code.Name: RHDI
Code.Description: The distribution of intermediate securities that gives the holder the right to take part in a future event.

Code.Name: RHTS
Code.DetailedName: Rights Issue/ Subscription Rights/ Rights Offer
Code.Description: Offer to holders of a security to subscribe for additional securities via the distribution of an intermediate security. Both processes are included in the same event.

Code.Name: SHPR
Code.Description: This corporate event pays shareholders an amount in cash issued from the shares premium reserve. It is similar to a dividend but with different tax implications.

Code.Name: SMAL
Code.Description: Modification of the smallest negotiable unit of shares in order to obtain a new negotiable unit.

Code.Name: SOFF
Code.Description: A distribution of subsidiary stock to the shareholders of the parent company without a surrender of shares. Spin-off represents a form of divestiture usually resulting in an independent company or in an existing company. For example, demerger, distribution, unbundling.

Code.Name: SPLF
Code.Description: Increase in a corporation's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are reduced accordingly.

Code.Name: SPLR
Code.DetailedName: Reverse Stock Split/Change in Nominal Value
Code.Description: Decrease in a company's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are increased accordingly.

Code.Name: SUSP
Code.Description: Trading in the security has been suspended.

Code.Name: TEND
Code.Description: An offer made to holders by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their securities.

Code.Name: TREC
Code.Description: Event related to tax reclaim activities.

Code.Name: WRTH
Code.Description: Booking out of valueless securities.

Code.Name: WTRC
Code.Description: Certification process for withholding tax reduction or exemption based on the tax status of the holder.

Code.Name: XMET
Code.Description: Extraordinary or special general meeting.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is PARS and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: PAIN
Code.Description: Confirmation is for partial settlement. Part of the instruction remains unsettled.

Code.Name: PARC
Code.Description: Confirmation is for partial settlement. No additional settlement will take place.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present, Sub-Balance Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K93) :

Code.Name: AVAI
Code.Description: Financial instruments are available for any purpose.

Code.Name: AWAS
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are freely available with no specific additional status.

Code.Name: BLCA
Code.Description: Balance of financial instrument blocked following a corporate action, including proxy activities.

Code.Name: BLOK
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are blocked.

Code.Name: BLOT
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are blocked for trading.

Code.Name: BLOV
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are blocked for verification of authenticity.

Code.Name: BORR
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that have been borrowed from another party.

Code.Name: CLEN
Code.Description: Balance of tax exempt financial instruments.

Code.Name: COLA
Code.Description: Balance of securities that are eligible for use for collateral purposes.

Code.Name: COLI
Code.Description: Balance of securities that belong to a third party and that are held for the purpose of collateralisation.

Code.Name: COLO
Code.Description: Balance of securities that belong to the safekeeping account indicated within this message, and are deposited with a third party for the purpose of collateralisation.

Code.Name: DIRT
Code.Description: Balance of taxable financial instruments.

Code.Name: DRAW
Code.Description: Balance of securities that are drawn for redemption.

Code.Name: ISSU
Code.Description: Balance for issued financial instrument where legal documentation has been received.

Code.Name: LOAN
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that have been loaned to a third party.

Code.Name: LODE
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are pending delivery in relation to a lending transaction.

Code.Name: MARG
Code.Description: Balance of securities that belong to and is kept in the safekeeping account indicated within this message, and that are used as collateral for derivatives.

Code.Name: NOMI
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that are registered (in nominee name or in the name of the beneficial owner).

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Balance of financial instrument that cannot be categorised, ie, is not identified with one of the existing sub-balance types.

Code.Name: PECA
Code.Description: Balance of financial instrument pending receipt following a corporate action.

Code.Name: PEDA
Code.Description: Balance of financial instrument pending delivery following a corporate action.

Code.Name: PLED
Code.Description: Balance of securities that belong to and is kept in the safekeeping account indicated within this message, and that are pledged , for example, to cover a short call .

Code.Name: QUAS
Code.Description: Balance for issued financial instrument where legal documentation has not yet been received.

Code.Name: REGO
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments currently being processed by the institution responsible for registering the new beneficial owner (or nominee).

Code.Name: RSTR
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that may only be sold under certain conditions or require legal documents.

Code.Name: SPOS
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that remain registered in the name of the prior beneficial owner.

Code.Name: TRAN
Code.Description: Balance of physical securities that are in the process of being transferred from one depository/agent to another.

Code.Name: UNRG
Code.Description: Balance of financial instruments that could not be registered due to foreign ownership limitation.

Validation.Comment: Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Proprietary code (Format Option R) and Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) and Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

fieldvalidation.name: U09
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "User has used tag 119 in a message that is not a candidate for special processing"

fieldvalidation.name: C1
fieldvalidation.comment: C1 The 'Balance From' must be different from the 'Balance To'. The Sub-Balance Type Code of field :93A::FROM must be different from the Sub-Balance Type Code of field :93A::TOBA. This check applies to sequence B(Error code(s): E81).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "The 'Balance From' must be different from the 'Balance To'. The Sub-Balance Type Code of field :93A::FROM must be different from the Sub-Balance Type Code of field :93A::TOBA. This check applies to sequence B"

fieldvalidation.name: C2
fieldvalidation.comment: C2 If the message is a cancellation, that is, Function of the Message (field 23G) is CANC, then subsequence A1 (Linkages) must be present at least once in the message, and field :20C::PREV must be present in one and only one occurrence of A1; consequently, in all other occurrences of A1, field :20C::PREV is not allowed (Error code(s): E08).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If the message is a cancellation, that is, Function of the Message (field 23G) is CANC, then subsequence A1 (Linkages) must be present at least once in the message, and field :20C::PREV must be present in one and only one occurrence of A1; consequently, in all other occurrences of A1, field :20C::PREV is not allowed"

fieldvalidation.name: FB-35B-B
fieldvalidation.comment: FB-35B-B ISIN is used at the beginning of Identification of Security (Subfield 1) and must be composed of uppercase letters only (Error code(s): T12).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: B.F35B.Identification_Of_Security + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FB-35B-B1
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";

fieldvalidation.name: FB1-35B-B
fieldvalidation.comment: FB1-35B-B ISIN is used at the beginning of Identification of Security (Subfield 1) and must be composed of uppercase letters only (Error code(s): T12).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: B.B1.F35B.Identification_Of_Security + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FB1-35B-B1
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";
